rdan 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Remove a Value From an RDA file

    removeRDA.Rd

    This removes a value from an RDA notebook file.

    removeRDA(name = NULL, rda = whichRDA())

    Arguments

    name

    character value indicating the name of the quantity to be removed.

    rda

    character value indicating the name of the RDA file in which to save the notes. The default is the value returned by whichRDA(), as set by a previous call to useRDA().

    Author

    Dan Kelley

    Examples

    library(rdan)
rdaFile <- tempfile(pattern = "rdan", fileext = ".rda")
useRDA(rdaFile)
storeRDA("2pi", 2 * pi, "circle perimeter divided by radius")
retrieveRDA("2pi")
#> $value
#> [1] 6.283185
#> 
#> $comment
#> [1] "circle perimeter divided by radius"
#> 
#> $context
#> [1] "/Users/kelley/git/rdan/docs/reference"
#> 
storeRDA("4pi", 4 * pi, "twice 2pi")
listRDA()
#> [1] "2pi" "4pi"
removeRDA("2pi")
listRDA()
#> [1] "4pi"
removeRDA("4pi")
listRDA()
#> character(0)
# Clean up
file.remove(rdaFile)
#> [1] TRUE
